events.name: South Africa issues blanket diplomatic immunity for August summit
events.wd_label: South Africa issues blanket diplomatic immunity for August summit
events.wd_description: South Africa issued blanket diplomatic immunity to all leaders attending an August summit, potentially allowing Russian President Vladimir Putin to visit without fear of arrest on an ICC warrant.
events.description: South Africa issued blanket diplomatic immunity to all leaders attending an August summit, potentially allowing Russian President Vladimir Putin to visit without fear of arrest on an ICC warrant.

events.name: BRICS summit details
events.wd_description: South Africa will host a summit of BRICS groups (Brazil, China, India, Russia, and South Africa) in August, with a planning meeting of foreign ministers expected to take place on Thursday.
events.description: South Africa will host a summit of BRICS groups (Brazil, China, India, Russia, and South Africa) in August, with a planning meeting of foreign ministers expected to take place on Thursday.

events.name: Department of Foreign Affairs' statement
events.wd_description: The Department of Foreign Affairs backed the immunity, stating it is a standard conferment for all international conferences and summits held in South Africa and is not for specific individuals.
events.description: The Department of Foreign Affairs backed the immunity, stating it is a standard conferment for all international conferences and summits held in South Africa and is not for specific individuals.

events.name: Russian air strikes on Idlib province, Syria
events.wd_label: Russian air strikes on Idlib province, Syria
events.wd_description: At least nine people were reportedly killed after Russian air strikes on the rebel-held Idlib province in Syria. The United Nations expressed concerns about the hostilities in the province.
events.description: At least nine people were reportedly killed after Russian air strikes on the rebel-held Idlib province in Syria. The United Nations expressed concerns about the hostilities in the province.

events.name: Casualties in Idlib
events.wd_description: Bombs dropped from warplanes killed nine people next to a market outside Jisr al-Shughour, and two others were killed in an air strike near Idlib city.
events.description: Bombs dropped from warplanes killed nine people next to a market outside Jisr al-Shughour, and two others were killed in an air strike near Idlib city.

events.name: Monitoring group's statement
events.wd_description: The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights monitoring group termed the attack the deadliest Russian attack this year.
events.description: The Syrian Observatory for Human Rights monitoring group termed the attack the deadliest Russian attack this year.

events.name: Russia's response
events.wd_description: Russia's military did not comment on the situation immediately. Their air campaign supporting the Syrian government has been crucial in turning the tide of the civil war.
events.description: Russia's military did not comment on the situation immediately. Their air campaign supporting the Syrian government has been crucial in turning the tide of the civil war.

events.name: Retaliation for attacks
events.wd_description: The strikes were said to be a retaliation for attacks that had killed civilians in government-held Hama and Latakia provinces.
events.description: The strikes were said to be a retaliation for attacks that had killed civilians in government-held Hama and Latakia provinces.

events.name: Extreme Weather and Smoke Pollution Affect Vast Regions of the United States
events.wd_label: Extreme Weather and Smoke Pollution Affect Vast Regions of the United States
events.wd_description: Large parts of the United States are facing extreme weather, with triple-digit temperatures in the south and southwest and widespread smoke pollution in the Midwest due to fires in northern Quebec. Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, and more than 40 million are under excessive heat notifications.
events.description: Large parts of the United States are facing extreme weather, with triple-digit temperatures in the south and southwest and widespread smoke pollution in the Midwest due to fires in northern Quebec. Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, and more than 40 million are under excessive heat notifications.

events.name: Extreme Heat in Southern and Southwestern US
events.wd_label: Extreme Heat in Southern and Southwestern US
events.wd_description: Temperatures in the southern and southwestern United States have reached triple digits, with a heat dome contributing to widespread excessive heat warnings affecting more than 40 million Americans.
events.description: Temperatures in the southern and southwestern United States have reached triple digits, with a heat dome contributing to widespread excessive heat warnings affecting more than 40 million Americans.

events.name: Smoke Pollution in the Midwest
events.wd_description: Smoke from fires in northern Quebec has caused significant air pollution across the Midwest, with smoke being carried southward by a north wind, affecting regions including southern Illinois, Indiana, and Kentucky.
events.description: Smoke from fires in northern Quebec has caused significant air pollution across the Midwest, with smoke being carried southward by a north wind, affecting regions including southern Illinois, Indiana, and Kentucky.

events.name: Warnings and Public Health Precautions
events.wd_description: Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, with officials in cities like Chicago advising vulnerable populations to stay indoors. Daycare and sports centers have also taken precautions to protect children from the smoke.
events.description: Over 80 million people are under air quality warnings, with officials in cities like Chicago advising vulnerable populations to stay indoors. Daycare and sports centers have also taken precautions to protect children from the smoke.

events.name: Ford's EV Production Expansion
events.wd_description: Ford Motor Company announced long-term contracts with multiple lithium suppliers to secure raw materials for scaling its electric vehicle production.
events.description: Ford Motor Company announced long-term contracts with multiple lithium suppliers to secure raw materials for scaling its electric vehicle production.

events.name: Lithium Supplier Agreements
events.wd_description: Ford has secured long-term lithium supply deals with multiple suppliers across three countries, with partnerships guaranteed through at least 2034.
events.description: Ford has secured long-term lithium supply deals with multiple suppliers across three countries, with partnerships guaranteed through at least 2034.

events.name: t: Albemarle Partnership
events.wd_description: Ford and Albemarle are exploring options to develop a closed-loop solution for lithium-ion battery recycling.
events.description: Ford and Albemarle are exploring options to develop a closed-loop solution for lithium-ion battery recycling.

events.name: t: Global Supplier Pool
events.wd_description: Ford has secured mineral agreements in Asia, South America, and North America to ensure a stable supply of raw materials.
events.description: Ford has secured mineral agreements in Asia, South America, and North America to ensure a stable supply of raw materials.

events.name: Supply Chain Development
events.wd_description: Ford is developing a more sustainable North American battery supply chain to fortify and de-risk its plans for sourcing key minerals.
events.description: Ford is developing a more sustainable North American battery supply chain to fortify and de-risk its plans for sourcing key minerals.

events.name: t: Indonesia Nickel Facility
events.wd_description: Ford invested in an Indonesia-based nickel facility set to open in 2026 to expand its supplier base.
events.description: Ford invested in an Indonesia-based nickel facility set to open in 2026 to expand its supplier base.

events.name: Production Site Expansions
events.wd_description: Ford is expanding its EV production sites across the U.S., including a $3.5 billion investment for its first lithium iron phosphate EV battery plant in Michigan.
events.description: Ford is expanding its EV production sites across the U.S., including a $3.5 billion investment for its first lithium iron phosphate EV battery plant in Michigan.
